tool.name: bams-to-ratio
tool.description: Normalize and compare two BAM files to output ratio, log2ratio or difference.
tool.command:
bams2ratio --bamfile1 '$bamFile1' -bai1 '${bamFile1.metadata.bam_index}' --bamfile2 '$bamFile2' -bai2 '${bamFile2.metadata.bam_index}'
--outFileName '$outFileName' --outFileFormat '$outFileFormat'
--fragmentLength $fragmentLength --binSize $binSize --smoothRange '$smoothRange' $doNotExtendPairedEnds
#if $region!='': --region '$region' #end if
#if $scaling.method == 'SES': --scaleFactorsMethod SES --sampleLength $scaling.sampleLength #elif $scaling.method == 'readCount': --scaleFactorsMethod readCount #elif $scaling.method == 'own': --scaleFactors '$scaling.scaleFactor1:$scaling.scaleFactor2' #end if
--ratio $comparison.type --missingDataAsZero $missingDataAsZero
#if $comparison.type=='subtract': #if $comparison.normalization.type=='rpkm': --normalizeUsingRPKM #elif $comparison.normalization.type=='1x': --normalizeTo1x $comparison.normalization.normalizeTo1x #end if #end if -p 1

param.name: bamFile1
param.label: Treatment BAM file
param.help: The BAM file must be sorted and indexed.

param.name: bamFile2
param.label: Input BAM file
param.help: The BAM file must be sorted and indexed.

param.name: fragmentLength
param.label: Length of the average fragment size
param.help: Reads will be extended to match this length. If set to the read length or smaller, the read will not be extended. However, the give size will be used together with the value given by 'normalize to 1x'. The formula to normalize using the sequencing depth is genomeSize/(# of mapped reads * fragment length).

param.name: binSize
param.label: Bin size in bp
param.help: The genome will be divided in bins (also called tiles) of the specified length. For each bin the overlaping number of fragments (or reads) will be reported. If only half a fragment overlaps, this fraction will be reported.

param.name: smoothRange
param.label: Smooth range using the following length (in bp)
param.help: An integer indicating the number of base pairs that should be considered when computing the number of reads overlaping the --binSize regions. Any value smaller than bin size will be ignored and no smoothing will be applied. When this option is in place, a sliding window of length 'fragment Length' would be considered to count the number of reads for each bin. In other words, the smooth range length defines a window, larger than the bin size, to average the reads. This window is advanced/moved over the distance defined in the bin size'.

param.name: doNotExtendPairedEnds
param.label: Extend paired-ends to 'fragment length' instead of BAM pair fragment length
param.help: By default paired-ends will be extended to match their respective fragment length reported in the BAM file. Setting this option will cause that paired-end reads will be extended to match the given 'fragment length'. In the case of single-end reads setting this parameter has no effect.

param.name: region
param.label: Region of the genome to compute the coverage
param.help: The format is chr:start:end Leave in black to compute the coverage for of the whole genome. This optionis useful to test different parameters without having to wait for the computation of the whole genome comparison.

param.name: method
param.label: Method to use for scaling the largest sample to the smallest.

param.name: sampleLength
param.label: Length in base pairs used for sampling the genome
param.help: The default is fine. Only change it if you know what you are doing

param.name: type
param.label: How the two files should be compared?
param.option: compute log2 of the number of reads ratio
compute the ratio of the number of reads
compute difference (subtract input from treatment) of the number of reads

param.name: type
param.label: Normalization method
param.option: Normalize to Fragments (reads) per kilobase per million (RPKM)

param.name: normalizeTo1x
param.label: Report normalized coverage to 1x sequenceing depth
param.help: Sequencing depth is defined as the total number of mapped reads * fragment length / effective genome size. To use this option, the effective genome size has to be given. Common values are: mm9: 2150570000, hg19:2451960000, dm3:121400000 and ce10:93260000.

param.name: missingDataAsZero
param.label: Keep zero read counts?
param.help: Determines if regions with zero counts should be ignored or keeped. If unset, regions with zero reads counts in both samples will be ignored and not included in the output file. Genome browsers like IGV can highlight such regions.

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool computes the normalized ratio/difference of the read coverage from two bam files.
